etymologies: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek erusipelas; perhaps related to eruthros ‘red’ and pella ‘skin’

definitions: an acute, sometimes recurrent disease caused by a bacterial infection. It is characterized by large, raised red patches on the skin, especially that of the face and legs, with fever and severe general illness.

notes.text: This is caused by Streptococcus pyogenes, a Gram-positive coccus

shortDefinitions: acute, sometimes recurrent disease caused by bacterial infection
